acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was deposited by Clifton Waller Barrett on December 17, 1963, accessioned on January 27, 1965, and made a gift on July 1, 1991.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of 8 items, chiefly correspondence and poems of Fanny Kemble.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged in two series. Series I consists of manuscripts and Series II consists of letters.

did.unittitle: 2 poems: "A Lover to His Mistress" and "A Rejected Lover to His Mistress" n.d.;
Poem: "Is the Picture of a Lady" n.d.;
G[eorge] Mifflin Dallas to Theodore Sedgwick 1849 June 28;

scopecontent.p: Concerns divorce settlement between Mr. Butler and Mrs. Butler (Fanny Kemble), and whether daughters will be allowed to accompany her home and remain during summer holidays.

did.unittitle: Frances Kemble to S. C. Bugbee n.y. Monday, Nov 12;

scopecontent.p: Concerns Mr. Bugbee's offer of advice and assistance in building her house in Lenox; Frances Kemble has not yet purchased land, so cannot use his services at the present time.
Concerns renting house in Lenox; Frances Kemble is leaving America and the cottage will belong to daughters; they will rent.

did.unittitle: Frances Kemble to Lady Theresa n.d.;

scopecontent.p: Sorry she cannot accompany her children tomorrow but will send their American nurse.

did.unittitle: Frances Kemble to Miss Susan n.d.;

scopecontent.p: "Susan Stevenson" pencilled in at top of letter; will leave for Germantown to finish packing; sympathy for Miss Susan's sister.
